sv.purpose: Wells kriterier kan användas för riskstratifiering och för att underlätta klinisk bedömning av nödvändiga vidare åtgärder.
sv.use:
Instrumentet kan användas för riskstratifiering och för att undvika överflödig undersökning med datortomografi hos patienter med misstänkt lungemboli.

Instrumentet baseras på följande sju faktorer:

Kliniska tecken och symtom på DVT: +3
Är lungemboli lika eller mer sannolik än annan diagnos: +3
Hjärtfrekvens >100: +1.5
Immobiliserad minst 3 dagar eller genomgått kirurgi senaste fyra veckorna: +1.5
Tidigare objektivt verifierad DVT eller lungemboli: +1.5
Hemoptys: +1
Cancer (Pågående eller avslutad behandling inom 6 mån alternativt palliativ): +1

Maximal poäng uppgår till 12,5p.

Resultatet kan tolkas med avseende på handläggning enligt två modeller där den senare inkluderar provsvar för d-dimer alternativt genomförd datortomografisk angiografi.

Utan d-dimer eller datortomografisk angiografi:

0-1p: låg risk (1.3%)
2-6p: måttlig risk (16.2%)
>6p: hög risk (37.5%)

Alternativ tolkning:

≤4p: lungemboli osannolikt (med d-dimer) (12.1%)
≥5p: lungemboli sannolikt - datortomografisk angiografi bör genomföras (37.1%)
sv.misuse: Är ej avsedd att användas för att fastställa diagnos utan primärt för att underlätta utredning i syfte att utesluta lungemboli.

en.purpose: The Well's criteria for PE quantifies the pre-test probability of the risk of PE and helps to group patients according to this risk allowing the physician to direct further investigation appropriately.
en.use:
The following seven variables with assigned scores were calculated to get the total score: 
- clinical symptoms of DVT (3.0)
- no alternative diagnosis (3.0)
- heart rate >100 (1.5)
- immobilization or surgery in the previous four weeks (1.5)
- previous DVT/PE (1.5) 
- hemoptysis (1.0) 
- malignancy (1.0)

There are two ways to group clinical probability based on the total score:
- Two-level model: 
     -   PE unlikely: score ≤4
     -   PE likely: score >4
- Three-level model:
     -   Low risk: score 0–1
     -   Moderate risk: score 2–6
     -   High risk: score >6
en.misuse: Not to be used to calculate or assess the simplified Wells criteria for pulmonary embolism.

other_details.references:
Wells PS, Anderson DR, Rodger M, Ginsberg JS, Kearon C, Gent M, Turpie AG, Bormanis J, Weitz J, Chamberlain M, Bowie D, Barnes D, Hirsh J. Derivation of a simple clinical model to categorize patients probability of pulmonary embolism: increasing the models utility with the SimpliRED D-dimer. Thromb Haemost. 2000 Mar;83(3):416-20. PMID: 10744147.

Lucassen W, Geersing GJ, Erkens PM, Reitsma JB, Moons KG, Büller H, van Weert HC. Clinical decision rules for excluding pulmonary embolism: a meta-analysis. Ann Intern Med. 2011 Oct 4;155(7):448-60. doi: 10.7326/0003-4819-155-7-201110040-00007. PMID: 21969343.

van Es N, Kraaijpoel N, Klok FA, Huisman MV, Den Exter PL, Mos IC, Galipienzo J, Büller HR, Bossuyt PM. The original and simplified Wells rules and age-adjusted D-dimer testing to rule out pulmonary embolism: an individual patient data meta-analysis. J Thromb Haemost. 2017 Apr;15(4):678-684. doi: 10.1111/jth.13630. Epub 2017 Feb 16. PMID: 28106338.
other_details.en: The Wells criteria are a standardized clinical decision rule used to assess the clinical probability of a pulmonary embolism diagnosis.

when: $gt0061|Immobilization (more than 3 days) or surgery in the previous four weeks|!=null
$gt0064|Malignancy (receiving treatment or palliative care or treated in the last 6 months)|!=null
then: $gt0071|Total score|=($gt0058|Clinical symptoms of DVT|.value+$gt0059|No alternative diagnosis|.value+$gt0060|Heart rate >100x/min|.value+$gt0061|Immobilization (more than 3 days) or surgery in the previous four weeks|.value+$gt0062|Previous DVT/PE|.value+$gt0063|Hemoptysis|.value+$gt0064|Malignancy (receiving treatment or palliative care or treated in the last 6 months)|.value)/2

gt0001.description: The Wells criteria are a standardized clinical decision rule used to assess the clinical probability of a pulmonary embolism diagnosis.

gt0047.text: Consider d-dimer testing to rule out pulmonary embolism or a rule out criteria such as PERC

gt0048.text: Consider high sensitivity d-dimer testing or CTA

gt0049.text: D-dimer testing is not recommended - consider CTA

gt0061.text: Immobilization (more than 3 days) or surgery in the previous four weeks

gt0064.text: Malignancy (receiving treatment or palliative care or treated in the last 6 months)

gt0077.text: Set low clinical probability of PE

gt0078.text: Set moderate clinical probability of PE

gt0079.text: Set high clinical probability of PE
